alert.note: Alert for Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 15 at 12:32PM MDT until March 16 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Utah... Santa Clara River between Gunlock Reservoir and St. George .Combination of snowmelt and excessive rainfall will result in elevated river levels and flows along the Santa Clara River between Gunlock Reservoir and St. George through Thursday afternoon. For the Santa Clara River between Gunlock Reservoir and St. George... elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt and excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Santa Clara River At SANTA CLARA AT ST GEORGE. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...Water has been noted to be at levels near the bank of the river in some locations, and minor flooding of nearby roadways in low lying areas is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to below flood stage with a maximum value of 12.3 feet late tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 12.9 feet. - Flood stage is 13.9 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
